routes.name: Watch Faces
routes.description:
::: tip
If you subscribe to [Updated watch faces for Amazfit X](https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/amazfit-x/updated)Ôºåwhere the URL is `https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/amazfit-x/updated`, extract the part `https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/` to the end, which is `amazfit-x/updated`, and use it as the parameter to fill in. Therefore, the route will be [`/amazfitwatchfaces/amazfit-x/updated`](https://rsshub.app/amazfitwatchfaces/amazfit-x/updated).

If you subscribe to [TOP for the last 6 months (Only new) - Xiaomi Smart Band 9](https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/mi-band/top?compatible=Smart_Band_9&topof=6months)Ôºåwhere the URL is `https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/mi-band/top?compatible=Smart_Band_9&topof=6months`, extract the part `https://amazfitwatchfaces.com/` to the end, which is `mi-band/top`, and use it as the parameter to fill in. Therefore, the route will be [`/amazfitwatchfaces/mi-band/top/compatible=Smart_Band_9&topof=6months`](https://rsshub.app/amazfitwatchfaces/mi-band/top/compatible=Smart_Band_9&topof=6months).
:::

country.description: Country ID, `us` as United States by default

routes.name: App Update
routes.description:
::: tip
  For example, the URL of [GarageBand](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/garageband/id408709785) in the App Store is `https://apps.apple.com/us/app/garageband/id408709785`. In this case, the `App Store Country` parameter for the route is `us`, and the `App id` parameter is `id408709785`. So the route should be [`/apple/apps/update/us/id408709785`](https://rsshub.app/apple/apps/update/us/id408709785).
:::

parameters.country: App Store Country, obtain from the app URL, see below
parameters.id: App id, obtain from the app URL

platform.description: App Platform, see below, all by default

routes.name: Security releases
routes.description:
::: tip
To subscribe to [Apple security releases](https://support.apple.com/en-us/100100), where the source URL is `https://support.apple.com/en-us/100100`, extract the certain parts from this URL to be used as parameters, resulting in the route as [`/apple/security-releases/en-us`](https://rsshub.app/apple/security-releases/en-us).
:::

routes.name: Download Hub
routes.description:
::: warning
1.  Open [https://ifi-audio.com/download-hub](https://ifi-audio.com/download-hub) and the Network panel
2.  Select the device and the corresponding serial number in the website and click Search
3.  Find the last request named `https://ifi-audio.com/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php` in the Network panel, find out the val and id in the Payload panel, and fill in the url
:::

routes.name: Apple latest beta firmware
routes.description: Download the latest beta firmware for iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Vision Pro, and Apple TV. Check the signing status of the beta firmware.

parameters.ptype: Fill in ipsws or otas to get different versions of firmware
parameters.pname: Product name, `http://rsshub.app/ipsw/index/ipsws/iPod`, if you fill in the iPad, follow the entire iPad series(ptype default to ipsws).`http://rsshub.app/ipsw/index/ipsws/iPhone11,8`, if you fill in the specific iPhone11,8, submit to the ipsws firmware information of this model

routes.description: The AI IDE for prototype to production

routes.name: Release
routes.description:
::: warning
Need to set up Notion integration, please refer to [Route-specific Configurations](https://docs.rsshub.app/deploy/config#route-specific-configurations) for details.
:::

::: tip Recommendation
It is recommended to use with clipping tools such as Notion Web Clipper.
:::

| O&O ShutUp10++ | shutup10    |
| O&O AppBuster  | ooappbuster |
| O&O Lanytix    | oolanytix   |
| O&O DeskInfo   | oodeskinfo  |

parameters.id: Software id, see below, shutup10 by default, can be found in URL

routes.name: Changelog
routes.description: Subscribe to Perplexity changelog for latest updates and releases.

routes.name: Apps
routes.description:
::: tip
To subscribe to [Apps](https://scoop.sh/#/apps?s=2&d=1&n=true&dm=true&o=true), where the source URL is `https://scoop.sh/#/apps?s=2&d=1&n=true&dm=true&o=true`, extract the certain parts from this URL to be used as parameters, resulting in the route as [`/scoop/apps/s=2&d=1&n=true&dm=true&o=true`](https://rsshub.app/scoop/apps/s=2&d=1&n=true&dm=true&o=true).
:::

routes.name: Software Downloads
routes.description:
::: tip
  Open `https://www.sony.com/electronics/support` and search for the corresponding product, such as `Sony A7M4`, the website corresponding to which is `https://www.sony.com/electronics/support/e-mount-body-ilce-7-series/ilce-7m4/downloads`, where `productType` is `e-mount-body-ilce-7-series` and `productId` is `ilce-7m4`.
:::

routes.name: Software
routes.description:
For some URL like [https://sourceforge.net/directory/artificial-intelligence/windows/](https://sourceforge.net/directory/artificial-intelligence/windows/), it is equal to [https://sourceforge.net/directory/?topic=artificial-intelligence&os=windows"](https://sourceforge.net/directory/?topic=artificial-intelligence&os=windows), thus subscribing to `/sourceforge/topic=artificial-intelligence&os=windows`.

  URL params can duplicate, such as `/sourceforge/topic=artificial-intelligence&os=windows&os=linux`.

routes.name: Universe
routes.description: Compose papers faster: Focus on your text and let Typst take care of layout and formatting.

parameters.id: Software id, can be found in URL, 279 as Western Digital Dashboard by default
